text: We will hear arguments next in 72--922, Paschall against Christie-Stewart.
Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court.
When did you first raise the equal protection issue, Mr. Legg?

I raised it in the brief to this Court, and the reason for that is that the case, the decision in the Oklahoma Supreme Court worked what I considered an equal protection situation, as compared with the previous case by the Oklahoma Supreme Court.
Did you raise it in your jurisdictional statements here?
I believe I did.
I couldn’t find it there.
It may have been the basic brief.
Does any property lien house at that time to the county?
It’s a lien.
Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court.
Well, in answering Justice White’s question, this journal entry of judgment on June 14th, 1965 did what Mr. Rolston said.
Well in then, there is a finding then in the trial court that you were barred by statute of limitations anyway?
There is a finding that the statute of limitations run, yes sir.
You’re the one that went to the Court of Appeals?
Yes, we appealed.
And you didn’t appeal from that finding?
No.
And then when the Supreme Court restarted the trial court’s judgment, those findings remain extent, is that not correct?
Yes, true.
